##

[![](figures/jekyll.png){width="25%"}](https://jekyllrb.com)

- Written in Ruby
- Is the underpinning of [GitHub Pages](https://pages.github.com)
- Renders Markdown and Liquid [^1] templates
- Uses YAML syntax files instead of databases


[^1]: Developed by [Shopify](https://shopify.github.io/liquid/), incidentally

##
[![](figures/jekyll.png){width="25%"}](https://jekyllrb.com)

First: Install prerequisites ([https://jekyllrb.com/docs/installation/](https://jekyllrb.com/docs/installation/))

<br>

  ```{.zsh code-line-numbers="1|2|3|4"}
    gem install
    jekyll new mysite
    cd mysite
    bundle exec jekyll serve
  ```
<br>
Visit your new website at [http://localhost:4000](http://localhost:4000)

##
[![](figures/jekyll.png){width="25%"}](https://jekyllrb.com)

### Basic concepts:

- Front matter tells Jekyll to render Liquid

::: {.fragment}
```default
---
title: Happy Little Trees
---
```

Liquid:

```default
{{page.title}}
```
:::

##

[![](figures/jekyll.png){width="25%"}](https://jekyllrb.com)

### Layouts
Say we want a template that displays the page's title. We might write HTML like this:

```default{code-line-numbers=|9}
---
title: Happy Little Trees
---

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
      <h1>{{page.title}}</h1>
  </head>
  <body>
  </body>
</html>
```
::: {.fragment}
Save this file as `mysite/_layouts/home.html`
:::

## {auto-animate="true"}

[![](figures/jekyll.png){width="25%"}](https://jekyllrb.com)


We've just created a template for our home page. Now let's find a way to reference and display it. 

Open `index.markdown` and notice the front matter. Add a title:

```default
---
# Feel free to add content and custom Front Matter to this file.
# To modify the layout, see https://jekyllrb.com/docs/themes/#overriding-theme-defaults

layout: home
---
```

## {auto-animate="true"}

[![](figures/jekyll.png){width="25%"}](https://jekyllrb.com)


We've just created a template for our home page. Now let's find a way to reference and display it. 

Open `index.markdown` and notice the front matter. Add a title:

```default
---
title: Happy Little Trees
layout: home
---
```

::: {.fragment}
Save and run `bundle exec jekyll serve`.
:::

## {auto-animate="true"}

[![](figures/jekyll.png){width="25%"}](https://jekyllrb.com)

### Data Files

Create the file `_data/navigation.yml` and add

```default
- name: Home
  link: /
- name: About
  link: /about.html
```

## {auto-animate="true"}

[![](figures/jekyll.png){width="25%"}](https://jekyllrb.com)

### Data Files

And then create the file `_includes/navigation.html` and add

```default {code-line-numbers=|2|3|4}
<nav>
  {% for item in site.data.navigation %}
    <a href="{{ item.link }}" {% if page.url == item.link %}style="color: red;"{% endif %}>
      {{ item.name }}
    </a>
  {% endfor %}
</nav>
```


## {auto-animate="true"}

[![](figures/jekyll.png){width="25%"}](https://jekyllrb.com)


Now pop back to `_layouts/home.html` and add our navigation bar:


```default
---
title: Happy Little Trees
---

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <h1>{{page.title}}</h1>
  </head>
  <body>
  </body>
</html>
```

## {auto-animate="true"}

[![](figures/jekyll.png){width="25%"}](https://jekyllrb.com)

Now pop back to `_layouts/home.html` and add our navigation bar:

```{default}
---
title: Happy Little Trees
---

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <h1>{{page.title}}</h1>
  </head>
  <body>
      {% include navigation.html %}
  </body>
</html>
```

- Actual content

##

![](figures/jekyll_themes.png){width="20%"}

My own website is based on [Minimal Mistakes](https://mmistakes.github.io/minimal-mistakes/)

There are (at least) two wasy to apply a theme:

- As a Ruby Gem by adding (for example) to your site's `Gemfile`[^2]:

::: {.fragment}
```default
gem "minimal-mistakes-jekyll"
```
:::

[^2]: If you want to use GitHub Pages, set this up as a [remote theme](https://github.com/benbalter/jekyll-remote-theme)

##

and 

```default
theme: minimal-mistakes-jekyll
```

to your site's `_config.yml` file

::: {.fragment}
Or you could just fork the theme (template) repository:

```default
https://github.com/mmistakes/minimal-mistakes.git
```
:::

##

![](figures/jekyll_themes.png){width="20%"}

mmistakes

├── assets
├── index.html
└── minimal-mistakes-jekyll.gemspec
```

```
:::

::: {.fragment}

[Follow these instructions](https://docs.github.com/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pages/configuring-a-publishing-source-for-your-github-pages-site)
:::


::: {.fragment}
Commit your Jekyll website to this repository and push.
:::

##
![](figures/uvm_silk.png){width="20%"}

- Silk is UVM's webhosting service available to UVM affiliates
- It's essentially an interface to an `Apache HTTP Server`
- Configuration settings are already straightened out

##

![](figures/uvm_silk.png){width="20%"}

- Silk won't build your Jekyll site
- Note the folder that appeared:

::: {.fragment}

```default {code-line-numbers=10}
mysite
├── 404.html
├── Gemfile
├── Gemfile.lock
├── _config.yml
├── _data
├── _includes
├── _layouts
├── _posts
├── _site
├── about.markdown
└── index.markdown
```
:::

##

![](figures/uvm_silk.png){width="20%"}

Procedure:

::: {.fragment}
Build your site

  ```
  bundle exec jekyll build
  ```
:::

::: {.fragment}
Copy the contents of `_site/` to your `~/www-root` directory

  ```
  cd mysite
  rsync -avz ./site/ <netid>.w3.uvm.edu:www-root
  ```
:::

::: {.fragment}
Navigate to [`<netid>.w3.uvm.edu`](ajbarrow.w3.uvm.edu)
:::
